p:
Apart from thermal expansion of the unit cell and larger Atomic Displacement Parameters (ADPs), the current structure is the same as the one originally determined. There was a single molecule of
1 a
in an asymmetric unit, with the pyrene moiety almost exactly planar (the average planes of the terminal benzene rings are inclined at an angle of 3.3(3)
∘
), and the carbonyl substituent rotated out of the average pyrene plane by only 8.0(2)
∘
. A relatively strong intramolecular C3–H3⋯O1 hydrogen bond [ 16] may be responsible for the almost perfect planarity of the molecule.
